markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Swashbuckler Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1859) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
<trait label="Multiclass" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=115" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 153 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Swashbuckler](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=43)

**Prerequisites**
Charisma 14; Dexterity 14

</column>

---

Choose a [swashbuckler style](/classes/swashbuckler/styles). You gain the [panache](/Classes.aspx?ID=15) class feature, and you can gain panache in all the ways a swashbuckler of your style can. You become trained in [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) or the skill associated with your style. If you were already trained in both skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in swashbuckler class DC. You don't gain any other effects of your chosen style.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the swashbuckler archetype.

<title level="2">Swashbuckler Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Flair](/Feats.aspx?ID=1860), [Evasiveness (Swashbuckler)](/Feats.aspx?ID=1865), [Finishing Precision](/Feats.aspx?ID=1861), [Swashbuckler's Riposte](/Feats.aspx?ID=1863), [Swashbuckler's Speed](/Feats.aspx?ID=1864)
name: Swashbuckler Dedication
